availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hotel in Louisville, Kentucky. Operated from 1833 to 1938. Proprietor(s): Samuel H. Drake and Stephen Haskell (1833-1834); William Bishop (1845); Radcliffe Fletcher and Michael Kean (1848); Michael Kean (1851); Kean, Steadman, & Company (1858); and Michael Kean, Thomas Steele, and Phillip Judge (1861-1865).

ab.bibl:
"Louisville Hotel," Kentucky Gazette (Lexington, KY), 28 Dec 1833, p. 3.
"Louisville Hotel," Kentucky Gazette (Lexington, KY), 10 May 1834, p. 4.
Haldeman’s Picture of Louisville, Directory and Business Advertiser for 1844-1845, (Louisville, W. N. Hadelman, Morning Courier Office, 1844), p. 294.
John B. Jegli’s Louisville Directory for 1848-1849, (Louisville: John C. Noble, 1848), 255.
John B. Jegli, A Directory for 1851-1852, in the City of Louisville, (Louisville: J.F. Brennan, Locomotive Printing Office, 1851), p. 178.
Louisville City Directory and Business Mirror for 1858-9, (Louisville: Hurd & Burrows, 1859), 275.
Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 ed. Henry Tanner (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 300.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 658.
George H. Yater, "Louisville Hotel" in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 554.
